name: McLNeuro
tweet: We will be posting more comprehensive awesome state and federal resources as well as information about how you can get a voucher from @metoostem to get trained up to be a better listener and advocate. #MTSTalk  Thank you everyone for joining us tonight!! üß°üíöüíôüíú  https://twitter.com/SciSwany/status/1111426425762930693¬†‚Ä¶

name: deanna ÿØŸäŸÜÿß
tweet: Male allies can use their privilege to advocate for victims internally. Listening to womxn and their experiences with sexual harassment, sharing how upsetting the situation is and emotionally validating the unfair situation can be incredibly impactful  #MTSTalk

name: Pomarrosa es cinismo hecho mujer.
tweet: Mirror how upsetting the situation is. Be emotionally validating #MTStalk

name: CJ McAdams MD PHD
tweet: #MTSTalk One of the most important ways people can support those involved in harassment/assault/discrimination is to NOT change the way that you treat that person. @ana_safavi

name: Pomarrosa es cinismo hecho mujer.
tweet: Unfortunately, retaliation happens more frequently than not. #MTSTalk

name: Pomarrosa es cinismo hecho mujer.
tweet: What you can do as a workplace peer that‚Äôs also an ally (when rumors are going around): -Treat the victim/survivor as a human being, how you normally would in front of other peers. Be seen together. #MTSTalk  https://twitter.com/McLNeuro/status/1111430624064069638¬†‚Ä¶

name: Erica Smith üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà
tweet: When I told my boss about what happened to me, he: - immediately believed me - validated my experience - said "what do you want to do? I will support you however you need" - supported me throughout my report and investigation  I couldn't have asked for a better ally.   #MTSTalk  https://twitter.com/McLNeuro/status/1111429744703102976¬†‚Ä¶

name: McLNeuro
tweet: Talking about workplace support @ana_safavi says one of the best ally moves is to hang out with 'trouble makers' publicly. You can joke around and see these folks are still friendly and kind. #MTSTalk

name: Erica Smith üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà
tweet: Agree - don't tell people what they "should have done" to "avoid" being harassed / assaulted. Also - don't tell people what they "should" be doing afterwards, or how they "should" be feeling. It isn't helpful!  #MTSTalk  https://twitter.com/SciSwany/status/1111429214001991680¬†‚Ä¶

name: McLNeuro
tweet: Being supportive and wonderful takes many forms. Sometimes it means just getting someone out of an awful experience #MTSTalk

name: Pomarrosa es cinismo hecho mujer.
tweet: ‚ÄúWhy didn‚Äôt you say no?‚Äù  ...is a nonsensical response to someone else‚Äôs experience. It doesn‚Äôt take into account the power dynamics and it‚Äôs a comment that usually comes from someone that has never been in a disenfranchised position. #MTStalk

name: Pomarrosa es cinismo hecho mujer.
tweet: Learn to listen! Avoid behavioral explanations and using the term ‚Äúshould.‚Äù #MTSTalk  https://twitter.com/McLNeuro/status/1111429161543847938¬†‚Ä¶

name: Dr. Teresa Swanson
tweet: ‚ÄúWhy didn‚Äôt you say no?‚Äù  Power dynamics are very difficult to get out of or act against when you‚Äôre the disenfranchised party. Don‚Äôt tell them what they did wrong! Just listen.  #MTSTalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: #MTSTalk Don't add judgement or questioning when talking to victims. Don't use the word 'should'. You 'should' have. #MTSTalk Use empathy and understanding. @carriejm007

name: McLNeuro
tweet: @carriejm007 is talking about how important it is to have an opportunity to be heard. We need to make horrible things a part of our national conversations instead of being angsty. There needs to be an awareness that power dynamics can't underestimated  #MTSTalk

name: Pomarrosa es cinismo hecho mujer.
tweet: Come join the wonderful @MeTooSTEM squad to talk about advocacy. The twitter chat happening right now! #MTStalk

name: deanna ÿØŸäŸÜÿß
tweet: '  https://www.thearc.org/sslpage.aspx?pid=2457¬†‚Ä¶ links to a page describing the intersection of sexual violence and people with a disability. '   -- @AmyMPalubinsky at #MTSTalk

name: deanna ÿØŸäŸÜÿß
tweet: 'RAINN maintains a database of 'Laws in Your State,' offering up-to-date source of information for students, lawmakers, and others seeking to understand sexual violence laws across the nation which can be found at:  https://apps.rainn.org/policy/¬† ' -- @AmyMPalubinsky at #MTSTalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: We also really like the DoJ's website about local resources for women exposed to domestic and work violence.  https://www.justice.gov/ovw/local-resources¬†‚Ä¶  https://www.justice.gov/ovw/local-resources¬†‚Ä¶ #MeTooSTEM #MTSTalk

name: Pomarrosa es cinismo hecho mujer.
tweet: If someone tells you that they were harassed or raped. Your first response should be ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so sorry this happened to you.‚Äù  Do not engage in the Olympics of pain!   #MTStalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: The Department of Justice offers free resources for training folks in getting certified as a volunteer and community advocate for victims of sexual assault.  Check out this amazing resource.  https://www.ovcttac.gov/saact/¬† #MTSTalk

name: Pomarrosa es cinismo hecho mujer.
tweet: How common is it for those that have experienced sexual harassment to display symptoms of eating disorders? #MTStalk

name: Dr. Teresa Swanson
tweet: @AmyMPalubinsky dropping all the resources in the #MTSTalk right now! Trainings, workshops, info, oh my!

name: Johanna Folk
tweet: #MTSTalk - do not engage in the olympics of pain. Instead, say ‚ÄúI am sorry that happened to you. That was wrong. How can I help?‚Äù

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: Any letters of support would be appreciated. If you do reach out please CC us and let us know. #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: We at MTS want to say thank you to all the folks who signed the petition supporting our founder @McLNeuro #MTSTalk  https://www.change.org/p/vanderbilt-don-t-fire-prof-bethann-mclaughlin-for-standing-against-sexual-harassment¬†‚Ä¶

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: Upcoming AMAs will include how to handle lawyerspeak when dealing with Title IX / HR / harassment cases. #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: ...unless you're checking in with people about their physical, emotional, financial well being, you aren't doing right by them.  Campuses need to hear this. If you want your campus to hear this then let us know. 2/2 #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: If your institution is interested in having a very honest conversation about what's happening when people report then let us know and we'll give that talk. The fact is unless you're checking in with people about whether they're being retaliated against... 1/2 #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: If we're not helping the next generation of students then we're not doing well. Keep us honest. We welcome any feedback and we want to make sure we're doing all we can. #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: What opportunities are we missing to get voices out on local campuses?? Let us know!! #MTSTalk

name: Dr. Teresa Swanson
tweet: #MTSTalk is so sick of bureaucracy.

name: Pomarrosa es cinismo hecho mujer.
tweet: Want to know more about the possibility of having access to a safe space/@MeTooSTEM room on campus or at a conference? Contact @BrittenyMWatson #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: If you are thinking about a larger group and are looking for us physically be there and to provide a room at a conference, then there are fees attached. @BrittenyMWatson is definitely the person to contact. #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: Contact @BrittenyMWatson for a list of asks and fees!  For smaller, easier events, we can provide swag, give startup questions, and provide logistical advice. #MTSTalk  https://twitter.com/JoshFessel/status/1103828154022617088¬†‚Ä¶

name: Britteny Watson
tweet: @AmyMPalubinsky in response to question from @joshfessel: "Contact @BrittenyMWatson (me) to help with setting up a safe space at a conference." I can hook you up with resources and swag. #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: Don't forget to use #STEMTrollAlert and @AlertStem ! These are men who have volunteered to engage with trolls who specifically are trying to waste women's time. When men engage with them, they tend to leave the conversation pretty quickly. (They're also hilarious.) #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: Regarding trolls - if you find it empowering, engage them! Don't forget to untag people, though - it's no fun to have all up in other people's mentions. #MTSTalk

name: Pomarrosa es cinismo hecho mujer.
tweet: A harasser's career shouldn't be prioritized over the safety of a trainee (or anyone's safety for that matter)! #MTSTalk

name: Britteny Watson
tweet: #MTSTalk--If trolls are making you crazy, tag our allies at #STEMTrollAlert and take care of yourself.

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: No training grants, no travel money, no serving on study section if you've been found guilty of a Title IX violation - some people have said no grant money ever, and that's something we're willing to talk about too. #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: That's part of what we're trying to do with NIH - you have to disclose a Title IX or HR finding of sexual harassment. #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: If you're at a public university you can request information through a Freedom of Information act. If you're at a private university they don't have to disclose Title IX Findings. #MTSTalk

name: Pomarrosa es cinismo hecho mujer.
tweet: It's important that we have a voice and get to say what happened. We need reform!  #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: FYI if you are being sued for defamation and going through an interogatory, you only need to give them information that your lawyers want this person to have #MTSTalk

name: Pomarrosa es cinismo hecho mujer.
tweet: We should be able to say the truth. #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: Check out the facebook event here #MTSTalk  https://www.facebook.com/events/311216889579013/¬†‚Ä¶

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: It is powerful privilege to say that someone doesn't get to speak the truth because you embarrassed yourself -- @McLNeuro #MTSTalk

tweet: Updates from @McLNeuro in Vanderbilt land -- "it's been a process" handling the tenure issues and the lawsuit #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: Talking about it all locally means that we can start to move to getting some accountability in your local communities. #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: .@McLNeuro didn't realize that she had the same Title IX experience until she read about another person's experience in the school paper. #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: But these things will start to run themselves, because people in large groups will soon find out that they have had a lot of (unfortunately terrible) experiences once you all start talking about it. #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: What we can provide: a starter swag box, starter topics to get conversations going, skyping in to help out with discussions #MTSTalk

name: Dr. Sharona Gordon
tweet: I distinguish between structural change and culture change. Structural change may require uncivil behavior to be effective. Culture change is different. I believe it requires kindness and respect. #MTSTalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: @hormiga talking about taking care of micro aggressions when they happen with bystander training. It needs to be socially unacceptable and you need to build this skill and practice. #MTSTalk

name: JoshFessel
tweet: #MTSTalk Getting some high quality thoughts on @9replyguys straight from one of the founders, the incomparable @sbarolo!

name: McLNeuro
tweet: @sbarolo talking about how common behaviors are for trolls and we have named those categories 'sealoining' for example. #MTSTalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: @ProfSharona talking about how hurtful comments are causing women to withdraw from discussions online. We need to drown out the hateful voices. #MTSTalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: @sbarolo is game for anyone who needs  help even if they don't identify as STEM per se, can use #STEMTrollAlert #MTSTalk @hormiga talks about how most of his readers are female, but most comments are from men.

tweet: Large amt trolling! Troll Watch: Online #Harassment Toward Women @NPRMichel. ‚ÄúAnytime a woman has the audacity to hold an opinion & express it in a proud or confident way online, they may become victim to backlash"‚Äì@NPR  https://www.npr.org/2019/01/06/682714973/troll-watch-online-harassment-toward-women¬†‚Ä¶ #MTSTalk #StemTrollAlert #HeForShe

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: Do the STEMTrollAlert folks actually know each other‚Ä¶.are they all friends? While they all consider themselves friends, this forum is the first time many of them have ever "met" each other... #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: The way they interact and engage with trolls can vary. Most do not believe in educating trolls - but engaging them and giving them somewhere else to go and troll... #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: Is STEMTrollAlert available to other women? Can it be advertised in minority groups as a resource? @sbarolo YES - he'll be there... @JoshFessel is in as well... #MTSTalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: @sbarolo is game for anyone who needs  help even if they don't identify as STEM per se, can use #STEMTrollAlert #MTSTalk

name: CharterForHealthcare

name: Dr. Sharona Gordon
tweet: @AlertStem is available to combat all types of online bullying.  #MTSTalk

name: Dr. Sharona Gordon
tweet: People who take risks on behalf of others are heroes. Got it, @McLNeuro? #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: @sbarolo hopes people will recognize him by his actions as a safe person to talk to but also wouldn't call himself an ally. #MTSTalk   Anybody got a better word for ally...???

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: On being called an ally... @hormiga it's tough because if you do good you're a great ally but if you do something dumb then you're a jerk ally or maybe not even an ally at all - and living up to expectations is hard bc people make mistakes... #MTSTalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: @MinorityPostdoc talking about men embracing the title as feminist. That it shouldn't be a toxic thing to care about women in that way. #MTSTalk

name: Dr. Sharona Gordon
tweet: Everyone has their own bias. Working on inclusion standing up for other groups requires self reflection to identify/mitigate our internal biases.  #MTSTalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: @ProfSharona giving a shout out to the reframing of toxic behaviors based on the @theNASEM report. The language was really helpful in advocating for women. The stats really helped. #MTSTalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: @hormiga @sbarolo Talking how ally is a tough label. Always interested in the engagement rather than an 'achievement'. #MTSTalk

name: Dr. Sharona Gordon
tweet: I think the label of ‚ÄúAlly‚Äù can be aspirational.  #MTSTalk

name: CharterForHealthcare
tweet: Study‚ÄìTroll Watch: Online #Harassment Toward Women @NPRMichel. ‚ÄúAnytime a woman has the audacity to hold an opinion & express it in a proud or confident way online, they may become victim to backlash"‚Äì@NPR  https://www.npr.org/2019/01/06/682714973/troll-watch-online-harassment-toward-women¬†‚Ä¶ #MTSTalk #STEMTrollAlert #HeForShe

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: @sbarolo admits he himself has been / done things that may have silenced another side in a conversation... but he believes that while educating trolls is not the goal - calling folks out can be helpful for those that are not intending to be hurtful #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: How much trolling is out there? Is it reflective of what you see from an everyday perspectives? @ProfSharona believes that the answer lies in intent... While most people are not trying to be hurtful and are well-meaning... trolls are often not #MTSTalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: @sbarolo Thinks men are often trained as poor listeners. It takes ATP to respond to their own biases and do more reflection on their own behavior. It's an ongoing educaton process for everyone (so true!) #MTSTalk

name: Terry McGlynn
tweet: #MTSTalk How do you distinguish a troll from a non-troll? One way to think of it that we're talking about is intent. But sometimes people who are not intentionally malicious in intent just want to express opinions that are destructive and aren't open to changing their minds.

name: JoshFessel
tweet: #MTSTalk Question was how #STEMTrollAlert identifies a troll vs someone who just disagrees. As @ProfSharona is explaining, intent is part of it. For me, refusal to listen & to recognize the views of others *at all* is part. Minimizing women (as @sbarolo is saying) is a feature.

name: Alberto Roca
tweet: thk u so much 4 invitation 2 participate in #MeTooSTEM #MTSTalk! My comment re: ex of my org's ally work is described in this @SarahRafaGarcia Tweet https://twitter.com/SarahRafaGarcia/status/1096495367623892994¬†‚Ä¶

name: McLNeuro
tweet: I am so happy to see great allies highlighted. Also, super hilarious! Read this! #MTSTalk  https://twitter.com/sbarolo/status/1100912682012733441¬†‚Ä¶

name: McLNeuro
tweet: My hero @MinorityPostdoc is on our #MTSTalk - he bravely called out @marcia4science at a public venue about having harasshole members. Excellent use of ally status. pic.twitter.com/TMLtMSs6Co

name: Kalynda Gonzales Stokes PhD
tweet: @JoshFessel discussed the importance of learning how to construct or deconstruct online arguments/disagreements: watch & learn from others! Excellent advice! #MTSTalk #MeTooSTEM

name: JoshFessel
tweet: #MTSTalk Question was asked how many people the folks in #STEMTrollAlert end up dealing with.  For me, it varies a lot.  Sometimes, not very many.  Sometimes too many to count.  Sadly, it's never zero.

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: Being gaslit hurts - but having men (in particular) stand up sets a model for everyone to follow and effects the entire culture. When one person acts out they look crazy - when many people act out they look right... #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: Many of these allies have found that apart from this being super helpful to colleagues, they have also learned a lot from others regarding construction and deconstruction of arguments...#MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: Sometimes men will listen to / respond to other men in a more collegial way. Not to mention the social cost for men is much less than it is for women to continue engaging in these situations... #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: What is #STEMTrollAlert? Online trolls take a lot of time and can be a physical and mental toll on women - this is a group of men that can be tagged in to help take on some of the burden... #MTSTalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: #MTSTalk @JoshFessel Got involved in #STEMTrollAlert after @sbarolo set it up. He can at least be a good rodeo clown. :-) Talking about being an ally  Read GREAT content from @sbarolo @hormiga in Nature today https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-019-00683-z¬†‚Ä¶

name: McLNeuro
tweet: What is #STEMTrollAlert #MTSTalk @sbarolo What if we got male allies to help women who are being harassed and having the power of men being annoying at the women's request. Create a batsignal. Some men will only listen to other men.

name: Dr. Sharona Gordon
tweet: @AlertStem is an effort to counteract trolls online who take up target's mental energy and time. "Use the power of men being annoying against itself" from @sbarolo #MTSTalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: .@hormiga talking up how important to be in real world as well as the Twittersphere @JoshFessel found twitter procrasting writing a grant (so say we all!) #MTSTalk One person looks crazy, a bunch of people look right!

name: CharterForHealthcare
tweet: Agree! Vital for college, grad/med school applicants, many others. How can we increase visibility, reach,use of database? @GeoEdResearch @McLNeuro @iba_vu @MeTooSTEM @dawnbazely @ProfSharona @kelseycpriest #MTSTalk @NPRMichel @AmyMPalubinsky @500WIM #500womensci @ColleenFlahert1

name: CharterForHealthcare
tweet: More general suggestions (off- and online) from a great #HeForShe ally @DrSinhaEsq on what male allies can do:   https://twitter.com/DrSinhaEsq/status/1053352581836136449¬†‚Ä¶ #MTSTalk #STEMTrollAlert @MicrobiomDigest @phylogenomics #WomenInSTEM @500womensci @500WIM

name: CharterForHealthcare
tweet: Study‚ÄìTroll Watch: Online #Harassment Toward Women @NPRMichel. ‚ÄúAnytime a woman has the audacity to hold an opinion & express it in a proud or confident way online, they may become victim to backlash"‚Äì@NPR  https://www.npr.org/2019/01/06/682714973/troll-watch-online-harassment-toward-women¬†‚Ä¶ #MTSTalk #STEMTrollAlert @AmyMPalubinsky #HeForShe

name: CharterForHealthcare
tweet: More advice from #HeForShe @HeForShe. #STEMTrollAlert #MTSTalk @MeTooSTEM @AlertStem @BoysWilBAcctble @RyanGilliom @lauramariani @toyaislesexism @FrancisDLJr @danjlurie @ganglion11 @MarkCBabin @Theiss9030 @sbarolo @JoshFessel @BoyleLab @raghupathirames @timevansphd @LaurelOld pic.twitter.com/Cyzxe8DDZJ

name: CharterForHealthcare
tweet: Our list refers to broader 'systemic' interventions that might help (not online harassment, sorry for any confusion!) @McLNeuro #MTSTalk

name: CharterForHealthcare
tweet: Another great resource for regular 'updates' to your faculty lists, listservs, institutional leadership, deans, chancellors, student groups, student and faculty newsletters etc. Free to download and use.  https://www.belowthewaterline.org¬† @BelowTheWaterUW TY @ProfSharona. #MTSTalk

name: CharterForHealthcare
tweet: Yes It's got to stop. If you haven't seen it, take a look at #theNASEM Rept on #SexualHarassment of Women.  https://www.nap.edu/catalog/24994/sexual-harassment-of-women-climate-culture-and-consequences-in-academic¬†‚Ä¶ Free download + resources. Disseminate widely to institutional & society leadership. #MTSTalk @MeTooSTEM @VUmedicine #vusmfaculty #vusm #WomenOnTrack pic.twitter.com/tiq50xRS2d

name: CharterForHealthcare
tweet: 4. Make larger; hang in all labs, depts, student areas, restrooms; post in student/campus newspapers. ‚¨ÜÔ∏ès awareness, deterrent. "We encourage people talking abt harassment involving #NSF researchers on social media 2 not only tag us but also please email us directly." #MTSTalk  pic.twitter.com/YBcFqNlADw

name: Berning For the Common Good
tweet: In an otherwise outstanding #MTStalk to @iba_vu, @mclneuro's #StemTrollAlert remarks appeared to get a somewhat less enthusiastic reception. I continue to hope that some in #MeTooSTEM will come to recognize STA as the liability it is.   https://twitter.com/LeniDiamond/status/1098342581472129024¬†‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/McLNeuro/status/1098687258021056513¬†‚Ä¶

name: CharterForHealthcare
tweet: 3b. For example, note #theNASEM report gives evidence-based findings & recommendations. Send regular - monthly at least - 'updates'. cc: admin people of leaders. Info could include:  https://www.nap.edu/resource/24994/Sexual%20Harassment%20of%20Women%20ReportHighlights-Federal%20Policy%20Makers.pdf¬†‚Ä¶  http://www8.nationalacademies.org/onpinews/newsitem.aspx?RecordID=24994¬†‚Ä¶ !ncrease awareness! #MTSTalk @McLNeuro @choo_ek pic.twitter.com/31bDHXNdzD

name: CharterForHealthcare
tweet: 3. Disseminate widely 10 institutional leaders, chancellors, deans, depts, labs, #TitleIX offices #theNASEM Rept on #SexualHarassment of Women.  https://www.nap.edu/catalog/24994/sexual-harassment-of-women-climate-culture-and-consequences-in-academic¬†‚Ä¶ Free download/resources. Easily done by email - send pdfs, bulleted summaries, infographics MONTHLY. #MTSTalk

name: CharterForHealthcare
tweet: 2. Encourage widespread reporting 2 Sexual Misconduct Database.The more reports in database, the better. Data talks; increases transparency. Set up team to help @GeoEdResearch keep it updated.  https://geocognitionresearchlaboratory.com/2018/08/20/the-academic-sexual-misconduct-database/¬†‚Ä¶ #MTSTalk Keep tweeting cases- also increases tranparency!

name: McLNeuro
tweet: @MeTooSTEM can you throw out the handles of everyone on the #MTSTalk so folks know where to find them?

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: BIG AMA THANK YOU to @HHMIJanelia for funding for #MeTooSTEM. #MTSTalk

name: CharterForHealthcare
tweet: We've been thinking about interventions that might help: 1. @Callisto provides tech 2 report #SexualHarassment/assault. Detects serial perps; protects/supports victims. Insist universities, labs set this up! Non-profit; by survivors.  https://www.projectcallisto.org¬† #MTSTalk @MeTooSTEM pic.twitter.com/wdc3xllSNd

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: @McLNeuro - use buzzwords when talking to admins! "SAFETY" is a big one. Tell them you feel UNSAFE.   In @SciSwany experience, use them in the legal processes too. It's how you will catch the attention of lawyers and judges.  #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: More @johanna_folk wisdom: "I just want to say how fucked up it is that we need to be getting the accommodations rather than the harassers being forced to work around us or be removed."  #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: @McLNeuro check out Title VII- disability and gender protections! Check out these resources particularly for whistle blowing, it may be a way outside of #TitleIX #MTSTalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: Interesting perspective from @evodevodeanna on using PTSD disability status to get work or teaching accommodations to avoid harasser. #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: @evodevodeanna Unions can take grievances as well, see how you can file with them.   Also, your anxiety/ptsd can be accommodated through the disability office. Requires dr notes but could keep your harasser away from you. #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: @McLNeuro- we‚Äôre still suffering and the process has to change. Let‚Äôs think about it over gin #TitleIX #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: Haha! @McLNeuro calling out the patriarchy. Of course. #MTSTalk  pic.twitter.com/szXxMKLpeo

name: McLNeuro
tweet: @carriejm007 talking up teaching hospitals - even working with a resident who is heavily supervised is a good entry point for psychiatry and great resource for students. #MTSTalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: @carriejm007 talking about serving as Student Health in psychiatry where you would see 'toxic labs'. Very different FERPA laws vs HIPA rules - you can't just talk to admin about the CAUSE of the problem. Who is the harasshole. Super destructive #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: #MTSTalk @carriejm007 saw a phemonemon of "toxic labs" - everyone in the lab is coming to student health services at the same time... including PIs!   FERPA and HIPPA made some reporting up difficult, and hard to address the root cause because of privacy laws.

name: Dr. P
tweet: Universities also often have free counseling services that are not always easy to find... seek them out #MTSTalk

name: Dr. P
tweet: In terms of finding a therapist, you may have to try a few and see which one fits... Also a tip from a therapist herself, "ask for a sliding scale." Often times there are people who will work with you and charge you based on your income particularly in / near campuses. #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: #MTSTalk @johanna_folk with more great suggestions! Contact your institutes Employee Conduct offices- they may be able to look into things #TitleIX wont look at.

name: Dr. P
tweet: #MeTooSTEM will be holding a future AMA regarding lawyers so stay tuned... #MTSTalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: #MTSTalk talking about how important it is to have good mental health care team to help you realize how much gaslighting you have experienced. Self care friends! @johanna_folk @carriejm007

name: Dr. P
tweet: Seeing a therapist is another way to help understand what is happening during these investigations - what is gas lighting? Am I being groomed?   And it can also help you build your confidence... #MTSTalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: #MTSTalk is talking about how important to get 'super lawyers' who have navigated Title IX.  I've had great experience with my lawyer @AnnOlivarius who is really changing the landscape and about reform.

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: #MTSTalk We all recommend having a THERAPIST. The feelings and actions are scary and confusing. What are you going through? What is the language you can use to express yourself? Therapy is crucial to making sense of your situation.

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: @KKgonza used her network outside of work to find someone in the community. Word of mouth references!  #MeTooSTEM #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: #MTSTalk  How did you find your #TitleIX lawyer?  @NeeleyEunice suggests googling, but also looking for super lawyers that know the university or the system

name: McLNeuro
tweet: Talking about how the @ucsf had to give the Title IX findings because they are a public university. Title IX findings from private school don't have to be disclosed. Eunice sharing about how important it was to have a lawyer and, for her, another victim. #MTSTalk

name: Dr. P
tweet: How do you get your Title IX findings? Public universities will had them over - a private institution does not have to - but you can try filing a freedom of information act... #MTSTalk

name: Dr. P
tweet: My mind is blown and my heart hurts here as I just realized that you "win" your Title IX process if, in the end, the Title IX office tells you, "Yep - you've been sexually harassed or assaulted." #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: #MTSTalk @NeeleyEunice was able to get her #TitleIX findings because she was at a public uni. If you're having trouble, FOI requests are only for public schools as well.   Does anyone have resources for getting info out of private schools?

name: Dr. P
tweet: Some folks choose to go public - in a big way - by seeking media outlets to tell their stories and restore their names... #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: #MTSTalk @McLNeuro recommends using the police to provide protection if necessary. @SciSwany cautions that going through public channels can be just as frustrating- not all judges know what twitter is.

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: #MTSTalk How do YOU deal with online stalking and harassment?

name: McLNeuro
tweet: @KKgonza talking about how creepy it is as a woman to have someone find you on Twitter and contact you using your IRL email and contact you. #MTSTalk

name: Dr. P
tweet: How do you deal with social media stalking and lurking? And are worried about it since so many academics use twitter? #MTSTalk #STEMTrollAlert!!! This is the number one answer from the group...!!!

name: McLNeuro
tweet: @SciSwany talking about how much of a mindfuck it is to have social media stalker as an academia when your job depends on communicating. #mtstalk

name: Dr. P
tweet: How do you deal with social media stalking and lurking? And are worried about it since so many academics use twitter? #MTSTalk

name: Dr. P
tweet: Some folks have had difficult experiences in terms of getting a restraining order to say / do what was needed - you may have to do some homework... #MTSTalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: Talking about getting a restraining order - and how you have to explain to courts stalking. It's often painful and demoralizing. #MTSTalk Writing the restraining order needs to be enforceable. @SciSwany got contacted without consequences.

name: Dr. P
tweet: Retraining orders, orders of protection, involving the police should not be a last resort... Your safety is most important!!! #MTSTalk

name: Britteny Watson
tweet: #MTSTalk @McLNeuro--PD will often give resources Title IX won't give.

name: Dr. P
tweet: Restraining orders and orders of protection are extremely important but not often used bc we label women who use them as "hysterical." Sometimes thinking about things in terms of "what if this were my trainee? Child? What would I want / elect them to do... #MTSTalk

name: Dr. P
tweet: In almost all cases, Title IX does not offer any resources to those who file. #MTSTalk

name: Britteny Watson
tweet: #MTSTalk Some women who have considered filing Title IX have been told not to file, or have been told their harasser's past won't be taken into consideration in their particular case.

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: #MTSTalk  Joint filing may strengthen cases, especially when the pattern of behavior is crucial to identify- when the harassment wasn't one incidenet. #TitleIX

name: Dr. P
tweet: Some women put off filing because their institution tends to push them that way. Some are told they need more concrete proof - not just a pattern of behavior. #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: #MTSTalk  There's this idea that going through the "proper channels" is the right way to go. However experiences are confusing, alienating and opaque.

name: Dr. P
tweet: Question - Has anyone not filed a Title IX and wish that they did? Or is anyone waiting on filing? #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: Well well well, everyones experience and process has been completely different.   There are multiple ways to report. TitleIX can be reported at the institute or at the federal level.   There also may be formal vs informal processes as well.   #MTSTalk

name: Britteny Watson
tweet: #MTSTalk Title IX processes vary drastically from university to university.

name: Dr. P
tweet: The other things that happens when these investigations drag out is that you may make a report as a student and then move on... If so, the "role" of the university in terms of "looking out for you" can change drastically #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: Seems like university #TitleIX offices like to lose paperwork, drop follow ups, and add hurdles to the reporting process.  #MTSTalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: Many victims feel like they are talking to someone who is incompetent in the Title IX office. @johanna_folk #MTSTalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: No contact orders go 'both ways' witnesses can't talk to accused which is sort of sketchy because what victim wants to talk to their harasshole? It's just legal coverage for universities. #MTSTalk

name: Dr. P
tweet: Often women continue to endure these investigations after they've moved on to new universities... if you need to do phone interviews, record if possible or ask to edit the notes before things go into the file... #MTSTalk

name: Britteny Watson
tweet: #MTSTalk @johanna_folk--Make sure you get a copy of your witness statement when dealing with Title IX, and make sure it actually represents your experience.

name: McLNeuro
tweet: Universities often try to run the clock out and can mischaracterize your quotes. Make sure you get a copy and edit or write your own witness statement @johanna_folk #MTSTalk

name: Dr. P
tweet: Title IX investigations are theoretically supposed to be over within a few months - but running the clock out on a complaint is much more common. Many women continue these investigations for years... #MTSTalk

name: MeTooSTEM
tweet: Hello! @SciSwany here for the live tweeting of our AMA happening RIGHT NOW. Chat with #MeTooSTEM leadership about their #TitleIX experiences.   DM for the link.   #MTSTalk

name: McLNeuro
tweet: #MTSTalk is starting be sure to follow along. Got about 9 ladies talk about their wisdom with sexual harassment. @johanna_folk is talking up how Title IX is too variable amongst institutions. Formal vs informal complaints. I'm a fan of federal filing for TitleIX.

name: Dr. P
tweet: Any questions for these amazing women who've fought the goof fight against harassholes? Tweet it out... #MTSTalk

name: Dr. Teresa Swanson
tweet: Andddd we‚Äôre live! Come hear the ladies of @MeTooSTEM talk about their experiences with #TitleIX   DM for the link.  #MTSTalk
